change.changenote: Regulation BEFORE repealed by BC Reg 202/2017, effective April 1, 2018.

bcl:section.bcl:text: In this regulation, licence means a licence issued under this regulation and includes the renewal of a licence.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The authority may issue a licence to an individual to act as a salesperson.
A person must not act as a salesperson unless the person holds a licence.

bcl:section.bcl:text: An individual may apply to the authority for a licence by submitting the form approved by the authority and the fee required by the authority.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The authority may impose conditions on a licence that the authority considers necessary.
Without limiting subsection (1), the authority may impose the following conditions:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a licensee must provide the information and records the authority requires under section 8;
a licensee must notify the authority of any changes to the licensee's address;
a licensee must not be employed by a motor dealer other than the motor dealer named in the licensee's licence;
if the licensee ceases to act as a salesperson, the licensee must immediately surrender his or her licence to the authority and request cancellation of the licence.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The authority may, on giving written notice to the licensee, add to or alter the conditions on a licence.

bcl:section.bcl:text: The term of a licence is to be not more than one year.

If the conduct of an applicant or licensee is, in the opinion of the authority, such that it would not be in the public interest for the applicant or licensee to be licensed or continue to be licensed, the authority may

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: refuse to issue the licence, or

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: suspend the licence for a period of time and subject to conditions the authority considers necessary.

bcl:section.bcl:text: the authority must notify the applicant or licensee by registered mail that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: he or she has the right to be heard at a date and place specified in the notice, and
if the applicant or licensee does not attend at that time and place, the matter may be disposed of in the absence of the applicant or licensee.

bcl:section.bcl:text: The authority may make inquiries and require information and records the authority considers appropriate or necessary to decide whether or not to issue, cancel or suspend a licence.
